headline: Visa, Caesars, Mondelez: Afterhours Earnings Roundup
summary: ↗️ Visa’s revenue climbed in its fiscal fourth quarter as healthy consumer spending drove payments volumes higher. Shares edged higher 0.8% afterhours. ↘️Caesars Entertainment shares fell 6% post-market after the casino operator logged a wider loss in its latest quarter as revenue from its Las Vegas business fell.

headline: Electronic Arts (EA) Q2 Earnings: How Key Metrics Compare to Wall Street Estimates
summary: While the top- and bottom-line numbers for Electronic Arts (EA) give a sense of how the business performed in the quarter ended September 2025, it could be worth looking at how some of its key metrics compare to Wall Street estimates and year-ago values.

headline: Electronic Arts (EA) Q2 Earnings and Revenues Miss Estimates
summary: Electronic Arts (EA) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of -4.72% and -2.45%, respectively, for the quarter ended September 2025. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

headline: Electronic Arts misses second quarter estimates on lower booking and high cost
summary: Investing.com -- Electronic Arts reported quarterly profit and revenue below Wall Street expectations on Tuesday. The videogame publisher posted earnings per share of $0.54, missing estimates of $1.30, while revenue came in at $1.82 billion, short of the $1.87 billion expected.

headline: EA’s Sales, Profit Drop After Lapping College-Football Launch
summary: The Redwood City, Calif., company posted a profit of $137 million, or 54 cents a share, for the three months ended Sept. 30, down from $294 million, or $1.11 a share, a year earlier.

raw.headline: EA’s Sales, Profit Drop After Lapping College-Football Launch
raw.summary: The Redwood City, Calif., company posted a profit of $137 million, or 54 cents a share, for the three months ended Sept. 30, down from $294 million, or $1.11 a share, a year earlier.

headline: Electronic Arts’s (NASDAQ:EA) Q3 Sales Top Estimates
summary: Video game publisher Electronic Arts (NASDAQ:EA) announced better-than-expected revenue in Q3 CY2025, but sales fell by 9.2% year on year to $1.84 billion. Its GAAP profit of $0.54 per share was 52.7% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

raw.headline: Electronic Arts’s (NASDAQ:EA) Q3 Sales Top Estimates

headline: Electronic Arts Reports Q2 FY26 Results

headline: Electronic Arts’ Earnings Meet Expectations Ahead of $55 Billion Take-Private Deal
summary: EA will no longer issue financial forecasts as it awaits a take-private acquisition by Silver Lake, Affinity Partners, and the Public Investment Fund of Saudi Arabia.

raw.headline: Electronic Arts’ Earnings Meet Expectations Ahead of $55 Billion Take-Private Deal
raw.summary: EA will no longer issue financial forecasts as it awaits a take-private acquisition by Silver Lake, Affinity Partners, and the Public Investment Fund of Saudi Arabia.
